intro: Ageratum reedii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Ageratum reedii thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators.
